1.text: To the chief Musician on Neginoth, Maschil, A Psalm of David, when the Ziphims came and said to Saul, Doth not David hide himself with us? Save me, O God, by thy name, and judge me by thy strength.

2.text: Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.

3.text: For strangers are risen up against me, and oppressors seek after my soul: they have not set God before them. Selah.

4.text: Behold, God is mine helper: the Lord is with them that uphold my soul.

5.text: He shall reward evil unto mine enemies: cut them off in thy truth.

6.text: I will freely sacrifice unto thee: I will praise thy name, O LORD; for it is good.

7.text: For he hath delivered me out of all trouble: and mine eye hath seen his desire upon mine enemies.
